intro: Oncocyclus ibericus, commonly known as the Iberian Oncocyclus, is a rare and striking member of the Amaryllidaceae family. It is native to the Iberian Peninsula and is characterized by its large, showy flowers with a distinctive red or orange coloration. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its foliage consists of strap-like leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. Oncocyclus ibericus is a protected species due to its limited distribution and vulnerability to habitat loss.
